It’s Class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.java not Client.java.

lol I did a miss type. It is in Class30_sub2_sub1_sub1
[/quote]

Hm, okay.
Which method in the client class did you paste it in?[/quote]

item.title: Simple errors in adding custom sprite
item.dc:creator: @Da_0wnz Da 0wnz
item.description:
@Da_0wnz wrote:

Ok thanks for looking. Can anyone help me fix this code for a custom sprite I added? Heres the compiling error:

[code]Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:71: illegal start of type
else if (s.startsWith(“iconh33”))
^
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:71: ‘;’ expected
else if (s.startsWith(“iconh33”))
^
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:71: illegal start of type
else if (s.startsWith(“iconh33”))
^
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:71: ‘;’ expected
else if (s.startsWith(“iconh33”))
^
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:71: invalid method declaration; return type required

else if (s.startsWith(“iconh33”))
^
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:71: illegal start of type
else if (s.startsWith(“iconh33”))
^
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java:71: ‘;’ expected
else if (s.startsWith(“iconh33”))
^
7 errors
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

And here is the code in client.java:

[code]else if (s.startsWith(“iconh33”))
{
try
{
anInt1440 = 25;
anInt1441 = 16;
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage("./Sprites/donator.png");
anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
pixelgrabber.grabPixels();

}
catch (Exception exception)
{
System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
}
}[/code]

I am using the Splicescape Client (it’s delta client based)

Please just fix the code for me and reply with it. THANKS!

Read full topic
